business.headline: Sensex crashes as Trump 2.0 spooks D-Street investors. 3 things to knowStock market crash: The Sensex tumbled 1,300 points to 75,773 at around 2:45 pm, while the Nifty50 fell below 23,000. All other broader market indices also collapsed during the trading session.

India could afford to cut back...: IMF's Gita Gopinath on Trump tariff threatGita Gopinath said that India's focus should be on domestic reforms rather than tariff battles as it looks to become a global hub for manufacturing.

Anshuman Mishra shares insights on Donald Trump's second term inaugurationInvestment banker and political strategist Anshuman Mishra provides exclusive insights from Washington DC on Donald Trump's second term inauguration.

Donald Trump's uncertain tariff plan keeps Dalal Street on edge. 3 key takeawaysUS President Donald Trump has decided not to immediately implement tariffs, leading to uncertainty among market investors around the world, including Dalal Street.

Adar Poonawalla shares his views on 70-hour workweek debateCEO of Serum Institute of India, Adar Poonawalla, shared his views on the ongoing debate about the 70-hour workweek, stating that human beings can not be productive after continuously working for 8-9 hours.

Adar Poonawalla on 70-hour workweek: Humans can't be productive beyond 8-9 hoursThe CEO of Serum Institute mentioned that there's no substitute for hard work but the quality of work, and working strategically is of importance.

Explained: Why Paytm share price fell 7% today and what's nextPaytm stock price: The drop in Paytm's share price came after the company reported its Q3FY25 results. Read to find out how brokerages rated Paytm's Q3 results and how the company's stock will perform in future.

Narayana Murthy clarifies 70-hour workweek remark: It's not wrong but is a choiceAfter stirring up a fierce debate on social media, Narayana Murthy has now suggested that the 70-hour workweek is a personal choice and should not be imposed on others.

Sensex tumbles over 800 points. Is Trump 2.0 behind stock market bloodbath?Stock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex was trading 800.18 points lower at 76,281 at 11:12 am, while the NSE Nifty50 dipped 200 points to 23,144.75.

Explained: Why Zomato shares are down 10% and what investors should doZomato shares were trading 9.42% lower at Rs 218.25 at 10:22 am. Shares of the food delivery giant had also declined in the previous session.

Stocks to watch today: Tata Technologies, Waaree Renewable, Reliance PowerAmid all the news regarding Donald Trump's tariff threat, several stocks such as Tata Technologies, Waaree Renewable, L&T Finance, Reliance Power, Vedanta will be in the spotlight today.
Sensex, Nifty open higher as IT and FMCG stocks drive early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 98.36 points to 77,171.80, while the NSE Nifty50 added 69.20 points to 23,413.95 as of 9:30 AM.

Stallion India IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing dateStallion India IPO allotment status: Investors who have subscribed to Stallion India IPO can check their allotment status on the online portals of the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd.

Want to avoid paying credit card annual fees? Here are 3 easy tipsSometimes banks may waive your annual fees as a goodwill gesture, if you are a loyal customer with a good credit history.

Global elites' wealth grew 3x faster in 2024; 4 new billionaires weekly: OxfamOxfam International, in its latest assessment of global inequality timed to the opening of the World Economic Forum meeting, also predicts at least five trillionaires will crop up over the next decade. A year ago, the group forecast that only one trillionaire would appear during that time.
Budget 2025: How can government make healthcare more affordableThe healthcare sector expects lowered costs on medical equipment in Budget 2025, thereby boosting affordability and accessibility.

Zomato shares decline 7% as Q3 profit tumbles over 57%Zomato Stock Price: Soon after the Q3 results were released, Zomato shares sharply declined over 7%, hitting a day's low of Rs 228.80. At market closing, the food delivery giant's shares fell 3.14% to Rs 240.95.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 16 Naxals killed in Chhattisgarh encounter, one carried reward of Rs 1 croreChhattisgarh Naxal Encounter: The interstate forces, acting on intelligence inputs about many Naxalities operating in the deep forests in the border area, launched an operation on January 19.

Donald Trump moves to end birthright citizenship: How will it impact Indians?Donald Trump's executive order to end birthright citizenship aims to revoke automatic US citizenship for children born to non-citizen parents. Here's how it will impact Indians.

With 20 lies on Day 1, will Trump break first-term record of 30,573 untruths?Donald Trump delivered two speeches after his inauguration on Monday and several media outlets fact-checked him. CNN put the number of untruths at 20. Trump averaged 21 lies a day in his first term, according to The Washington Post. This is why Trump's Day 1 of his second term could herald a return to a fact-check era.

Saif Ali Khan to be discharged from hospital shortlyActor Saif Ali Khan will be discharged from the hospital on January 21. He was hospitalised at Mumbai's Lilavati hospital after being stabbed during a burglary bid at his Bandra house.

BJP woos students with financial aid, AAP calls it attempt to end free educationThe BJP unveiled its second manifesto for the Delhi elections on Tuesday. Key promises include financial assistance of Rs 15,000 for competitive exam aspirants and free education up to the postgraduate level, if voted to power in the national capital.

10 killed, 32 injured in fire at hotel in Turkey ski resortThe fire broke out at around 3.30 am in the restaurant of the 12-storey Grand Kartal hotel in the resort of Kartalkaya in Bolu province, officials and reports said. The cause of the fire was under investigation.

Melbourne Blockbuster: All you need to know about Djokovic vs AlcarazNovak Djokovic, the 10-time Australian Open champion, is determined to prove a point to his naysayers after failing to win a Grand Slam last year. The Serb faces a significant challenge as early as the quarter-finals, where he will take on Carlos Alcaraz on Tuesday. Meanwhile, Alcaraz will be aiming for his first victory over Djokovic on hard courts.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.
